clinical_features.appearance: White, atrophic, stellate plaques surrounded by telangiectasia and hyperpigmentation
clinical_features.pathology: Capillary loss with epidermal atrophy and dermal sclerosis
clinical_features.clinical_significance: Extremely fragile - high risk for ulceration with minimal trauma
clinical_features.differential: Livedoid vasculopathy (different mechanism but similar appearance)

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

clinical_pearls: White color indicates complete loss of capillary blood supply
Extremely fragile - counsel patients to protect from trauma
Often coexists with lipodermatosclerosis and hyperpigmentation
